class wp4.compare.models.donor.Donor(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Extension of an Patient record (via OneToOne link for good ORM/DB management) to capture the Donor specific data

Also holds the meta-data specific to the Procurement Form

person¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

sequence_number¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

NON_RANDOMISATION_CHOICES = ((0, 'Not applicable'), (1, 'Donor not proceeding'), (2, 'One or more kidneys allocated to non-trial location'), (3, 'Kidneys not allocated'), (4, 'Kidneys not transplantable'), (5, 'Other'))¶

Donor not_randomised_because choices

multiple_recipients¶

Choices limited to YES_NO_UNKNOWN_CHOICES

country_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the country to be used for geographic restriction of this data :return: Int: Value from list in Locations.Models. Should be in range [1,4,5]

location_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the location to be used for geographic restriction of this data :return: Int: Hospital object id

clean()[source]¶

Clears the following fields of data if their corresponding unknown flag is set to True

  • call_received
  • scheduled_start
  • technician_arrival
  • ice_boxes_filled
  • depart_perfusion_centre
  • arrival_at_donor_hospital
  • date_of_admission
  • date_admitted_to_itu
  • diuresis_last_day
  • diuresis_last_hour
  • systolic_pressure_low
  • o2_saturation
  • circulatory_arrest
  • perfusion_started

Error if:

  • arrival_at_donor_hospital before depart_perfusion_centre (DOv01)
  • age does not match person.age_from_dob (DOv05)
  • date_of_birth is less than 50 years before date_of_procurement (DOv03)
  • date_of_birth is more than 100 years before date_of_procurement (DOv04)
  • date_of_procurement before date_of_admission (DOv06)
  • admitted_to_itu without recording date_admitted_to_itu (DOv07)
  • diagnosis is set to Other, and diagnosis_other is empty (DOv08)
  • date_admitted_to_itu before date_of_admission (DOv12)
  • life_support_withdrawal before date_of_admission (DOv09)
  • circulatory_arrest after death_diagnosed (DOv10) - a pre-requisite for DCD case eligibility
  • systemic_flush_used is set to Other, but systemic_flush_used_other is empty (DOv11)
  • procurement_form_completed is True, but: retrieval_hospital is not set (DOv12); and person.number is empty (DOv13)
save(force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)[source]¶

Updated save method to ensure that if death_diagnosed is set, then this is reflected in the same value for person.date_of_death

Parameters:
  • force_insert – bool. As parent method
  • force_update – bool. As parent method
  • using – As parent method
  • update_fields – As parent method
Returns:

super(Donor, self).save()
randomise(is_online=True, active_user=None)[source]¶

Randomise if eligible and not already done. This is determined by looking at the elibility criteria, and checking that the Organ.preservation is not set. Once randomised, the sequence_number is allocated for the Trial ID to be defined. The location of the retrieval_team is used to determine which geographical list set to use, and the is_online value determines which of the two lists to pick from.

Parameters:
  • is_online – bool. Pick from an online list if True, or an Offline list if False
  • active_user – The user that is triggering the randomisation process
Returns:

True if randomisation occurs, False otherwise
Return type:

bool
left_kidney¶

Property to emulate a safe get_or_create call to Organ. If no linked organ, a new record is created with sensible defaults and linked.

Returns:Organ record for the left kidney
Return type:wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ
right_kidney¶

Property to emulate a safe get_or_create call to Organ. If no linked organ, a new record is created with sensible defaults and linked.

Returns:Organ record for the right kidney
Return type:wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ
centre_code¶

Does a safe lookup for the centre_code of the retrieval_team. If no team set, returns 0

Returns:Centre code, or 0
Return type:int
make_trial_id()[source]¶

Returns the composite trial id string.

Returns:‘WP4cctnns’ - where:
  • cc = 2 digit centre code
  • t = single digit, 0 for online, 9 for offline randomisation
  • nn = 2 digit sequence number, starting at 01
  • s = (optional) single character denoting organ location, L for Left, R for Right

If no centre_code set or a lack of sequence_number, returns “No Trial ID Assigned (DOnnn)” where nnn = the object’s ID
Return type:str
is_offline¶

Determine if this was randomised using the relevant online or offline lists

Returns:True, if randomisation.list_code matches PAPER_EUROPE or PAPER_UNITED_KINGDOM
Return type:bool
is_randomised¶

Checks the left_kidney.preservation value, and if PRESERVATION_NOT_SET, returns False.

Returns:True if the left kidney has been randomised
Return type:bool
count_of_eligible_organs¶

Number of eligible kidneys from this donor.

Returns:0, 1, or 2 kidneys, and -1 for not randomised
Return type:int

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

organ_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

country_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the country to be used for geographic restriction of this data.

Organs move around, thus we have to look through their likely locations in reverse to determine where it is

Returns:Int: Value from list in Locations.Models. Should be in range [1,4,5]
location_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the location to be used for geographic restriction of this data

Organs move around, thus we have to look through their likely locations in reverse to determine where it is

Returns:Int: Hospital object id
clean()[source]¶

Clears the following fields of data if their corresponding unknown flag is set to True

  • oxygen_bottle_changed_at
  • ice_container_replenished_at

Error if:

  • transplantable is False, and not_transplantable_reason is empty (ORv01)
  • perfusion_possible is False, and perfusion_not_possible_because is empty (ORv02)
  • perfusion_possible is True, and perfusion_started is not set (ORv03)
safe_recipient¶

Helper method to return either the related Recipient record, or a safe value of None, without the drama of exceptions when it doesn’t exist

Return type:wp4.compare.models.transplantation.Recipient

Return type:str
is_allocated¶

Allocation status

Determine if an organ has been allocated. Allocated means:

  • To a recipient at a project site
  • Final allocation is to a non-project site
Returns:True, if either of those criteria are met
Return type:bool
explain_is_allocated¶

Allocation status description – An explanation as to the allocation status for this organ

Returns:Message describing status of allocation
Return type:str
explain_closed_status¶

Work out why this form was closed, and display a suitable summary message

NOT IMPLEMENTED (yet)

Returns:Message describing the likely cause for the form being closed
Return type:str
was_cold_stored¶

A kidney should be flagged as COLD STORED when (1) OR (2) where (1) if wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ - perfusion_possible (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR09 machine perfusion possible?” is FALSE (2) if “Was the kidney cold stored because of a machine problem” in the Transplantation form is TRUE

See discussion in Issue 166 for more detail

Returns:True if criteria are met, False otherwise
Return type:bool
reallocation_count¶

Counts the number of organ allocations where reallocated is true

Returns:Count of reallocations
Return type:int
graft_failed¶

Scan through the follow ups to determine if there is a graft failure reported for this organ. We can afford to presume that if something fails in this sequence there is no point looking for later related objects.

Returns:0, if no failures. 1 for Initial, 2 for Month 3, 3 for Month 6, and 4 for Month 12
Return type:int
followup_3m_begin_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up can begin by. This is the randomisation date + 70 days :return:

followup_3m_completed_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up should be completed by. This is the randomisation date + 91 + 21 days :return:

followup_6m_begin_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up can begin by. This is the randomisation date + 150 days :return:

followup_6m_completed_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up should be completed by. This is the randomisation date + 182 + 32 days :return:

followup_final_begin_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up can begin by. This is the randomisation date + 300 days :return:

followup_final_completed_by¶

Returns the date that the final follow up should be completed by. This is the randomisation date + 365+65 days :return:

class wp4.compare.models.donor.ProcurementResource(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Repeatable list of resources used during organ extraction. Primarily distinguished by the type. This is an extension of the Procurement form for each organ. Geographical restrictions on this are mostly moot, but defer to Organ if needed

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – ID as “ID”
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – record locked as “record locked” - record locked
  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – live as “live”
  • organ_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – Kidney as “Kidney”
  • type (django.db.models.CharField) – Resource used as “Resource used”
  • lot_number (django.db.models.CharField) – Lot number as “Lot number”
  • expiry_date (django.db.models.DateField) – Expiry date as “Expiry date”
  • expiry_date_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – expiry date unknown as “expiry date unknown” - expiry date unknown
